io.github.plemont.ranges

Class Ranges.RangeContext

  • Object
    • Ranges.RangeContext
  • Enclosing class:
    Ranges

    static class Ranges.RangeContext
extends Object
    Inner context class, used for building and modifying the range prior to output in the desired format.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • withSheetName

        public Ranges.RangeContext withSheetName(String sheetName)
        Sets or overwrites the Sheet name for this context.

        The supplied sheetName is tested for validity, See isValidSheetName(String) for details of what formats for sheetName are accepted.

        Parameters:
        sheetName - The desired name for the Sheet.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.

      • withSheetId

        public Ranges.RangeContext withSheetId(int sheetId)
        Sets of overwrites the Sheet ID for this context.
        Parameters:
        sheetId - The desired ID for the Sheet.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.

      • withWidth

        public Ranges.RangeContext withWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the range, taken from the anchored start column.
        Parameters:
        width - The number of columns wide for the range. For example 3 would include columns A,B and C, if the start column is set to A.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the start column is not set.

      • withHeight

        public Ranges.RangeContext withHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the range, taken from the anchored start row.
        Parameters:
        height - The number of rows for the range. For example 3 would include rows 1, 2 and 3, if the start row is set to row 1.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the start row is not set.

      • withStartColumn

        public Ranges.RangeContext withStartColumn(int startColumn)
        Sets the starting column for the range.

        As well as setting the value for the startColumn, where both the startColumn and endColumn are set, these are checked such that startColumn <= endColumn.

        Parameters:
        startColumn - The zero-indexed start column.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.

      • withStartRow

        public Ranges.RangeContext withStartRow(int startRow)
        Sets the starting row for the range.

        As well as setting the value for the startRow, where both the startRow and endRow are set, these are checked such that startRow <= endRow.

        Parameters:
        startRow - The zero-indexed start row.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.

      • withEndColumn

        public Ranges.RangeContext withEndColumn(int endColumn)
        Sets the end column for the range.

        As well as setting the value for the endColumn, where both the startColumn and endColumn are set, these are checked such that startColumn <= endColumn.

        Parameters:
        endColumn - The zero-indexed end column, inclusive. e.g. 3 sets the fourth column as the last column included in the range.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the start column is not set.

      • withEndRow

        public Ranges.RangeContext withEndRow(int endRow)
        Sets the end row for the range.

        As well as setting the value for the endRow, where both the startRow and endRow are set, these are checked such that startRow <= endRow.

        Parameters:
        endRow - The zero-indexed end row, inclusive. e.g. 3 sets the fourth row as the last row included in the range.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the start row is not set.

      • withStartCell

        public Ranges.RangeContext withStartCell(String a1Cell)
        Sets the start cell for a range.
        Parameters:
        a1Cell - The start cell for the range, in A1 notation, e.g. A1 represents the cell (0, 0). Where endColumn and/or endRow has been set, either individually or through withEndCell, ordering is checked to ensure that startColumn <= endColumn and startRow <= endRow.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified cell format is invalid.

      • withEndCell

        public Ranges.RangeContext withEndCell(String a1Cell)
        Sets the end cell for a range.
        Parameters:
        a1Cell - The end cell for the range, in A1 notation, e.g. A1 represents the cell (0, 0). Column and row ordering is then checked to ensure that startColumn <= endColumn and startRow <= endRow.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified cell format is invalid.

      • clearStartColumn

        public Ranges.RangeContext clearStartColumn()
        Clears the start column. Used for creating unbounded ranges from bounded ranges.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if attempting to unset the start column when end column is set.

      • clearStartRow

        public Ranges.RangeContext clearStartRow()
        Clears the start row. Used for creating unbounded ranges from bounded ranges.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if attempting to unset the start row when end row is set.

      • clearEndColumn

        public Ranges.RangeContext clearEndColumn()
        Clears the end column. Used for creating unbounded ranges from bounded ranges.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.

      • clearEndRow

        public Ranges.RangeContext clearEndRow()
        Clears the end row. Used for creating unbounded ranges from bounded ranges.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.

      • expandRows

        public Ranges.RangeContext expandRows(int numExtraRows)
        Expands the height of the range by the specified number of rows.
        Parameters:
        numExtraRows - The number of extra rows to add to the range.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if attempting to expand a range with no start or end rows.

      • expandColumns

        public Ranges.RangeContext expandColumns(int numExtraColumns)
        Expands the width of the range by the specified number of columns.
        Parameters:
        numExtraColumns - The number of extra rows to add to the range.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if attempting to expand a range with no start or end columns.

      • translate

        public Ranges.RangeContext translate(int deltaX,
                                     int deltaY)
        Translates a range by the specified (x, y) adjustment.

        Translating a range requires that the start column or row is set for any non-zero x or y-axis adjusts respectively.

        Parameters:
        deltaX - The number of columns to translate by.
        deltaY - The number of rows to translate by.
        Returns:
        the RangeContext object for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if attempting to translate along an axis where no start is set.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delta would translate to a negative column or row.

      • toRange

        public String toRange()
        Forms a range String from the current context.

        Range strings identify an area of a given Sheet, as specifically as a single cell, or to as generally as the whole Sheet, for example:

        • Sheet1 - Basic range, specifying the entire Sheet named Sheet1.
        • Sheet1!A1 - The cell (0, 0) for Sheet1.
        • Sheet1!A1:C4 - The rectangular area from (0, 0) to (2, 3) inclusive.
        • Sheet1!A:C - The first three columns in Sheet1 inclusive.
        • Sheet1!2:6 - The second to sixth rows in Sheet1 inclusive.
        • Sheet1:A4:E - The first five columns, starting at row 4.
        • 'Today''s data'!A1 - A range for Sheet with name "Today's data", using single-quote escaping.
        Returns:
        the range string.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current context cannot be converted to a range String.

      • toGridRange

        public GridRange toGridRange()
        Creates a GridRange from the current context.
        Returns:
        the created GridRange.

      • toStartGridCoordinate

        public GridCoordinate toStartGridCoordinate()
        Creates a GridCoordinate from the start cell of the current context.
        Returns:
        the created GridCoordinate.

      • toEndGridCoordinate

        public GridCoordinate toEndGridCoordinate()
        Creates a GridCoordinate from the end cell of the current context.
        Returns:
        the created GridCoordinate.

      • getSheetName

        public String getSheetName()
        Retrieve the name of the Sheet in the current context.
        Returns:
        the sheet name.
